Base font can be one of (keep in mind that these may not exist on all clients if they are not shipped with starfall): 
- Akbar 
- Coolvetica 
- Roboto 
- Courier New 
- Verdana 
- Arial 
- HalfLife2 
- hl2mp 
- csd 
- Tahoma 
- Trebuchet 
- Trebuchet MS 
- DejaVu Sans Mono 
- Lucida Console 
- Times New Roman

param.additive: If true, adds brightness to pixels behind it rather than drawing over them.

getTextureID.ret: Texture table. Use it with render.setTexture. Returns nil if max url textures is reached.
getTextureID.name: render_library.getTextureID
getTextureID.summary: Looks up a texture by file name.
getTextureID.description:
Looks up a texture by file name. Use with render.setTexture to draw with it. 
Make sure to store the texture to use it rather than calling this slow function repeatedly.

param.tx: Texture file path, or a http url
param.alignment: Optional alignment for the url texture. Default: "center", See http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/pr_background-position.asp
param.cb: Optional callback for when a url texture finishes loading. param1 - The texture table, param2 - The texture url

setFont.name: render_library.setFont
setFont.usage:
Use a font created by render.createFont or use one of these already defined fonts: 
- DebugFixed 
- DebugFixedSmall 
- Default 
- Marlett 
- Trebuchet18 
- Trebuchet24 
- HudHintTextLarge 
- HudHintTextSmall 
- CenterPrintText 
- HudSelectionText 
- CloseCaption_Normal 
- CloseCaption_Bold 
- CloseCaption_BoldItalic 
- ChatFont 
- TargetID 
- TargetIDSmall 
- HL2MPTypeDeath 
- BudgetLabel 
- HudNumbers 
- DermaDefault 
- DermaDefaultBold 
- DermaLarge

param.poly: Table of polygon vertices. Texture coordinates are optional. {{x=x1, y=y1, u=u1, v=v1}, ... }

Lua's xpcall with SF throw implementation

Lua's xpcall with SF throw implementation

If execution fails, this returns false and the second function is called with the error message.

builtin.name: builtin

ret: Status of the execution; true for success, false for failure.
The returns of the first function if execution succeeded, otherwise the first return value of the error callback.
xpcall.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.xpcall
xpcall.summary:
Lua's xpcall with SF throw implementation 
Attempts to call the first function.
xpcall.description:
Lua's xpcall with SF throw implementation 
Attempts to call the first function. If the execution succeeds, this returns true followed by the returns of the function. 
If execution fails, this returns false and the second function is called with the error message.

param.The: function to be called if execution of the first fails; the error message is passed as a string.
param.arguments: Arguments to pass to the initial function.

chip.description: Returns the entity representing a processor that this script is running on.
chip.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.chip
chip.summary: Returns the entity representing a processor that this script is running on.

hasPermission.description: Checks if the chip is capable of performing an action.

printMessage.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.printMessage
printMessage.summary: Prints a message to your chat, console, or the center of your screen.
printMessage.description: Prints a message to your chat, console, or the center of your screen.

param.mtype: How the message should be displayed. See http://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Enums/HUD

quotaUsed.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaUsed
quotaUsed.summary: Returns the current count for this Think's CPU Time.
quotaUsed.description:
Returns the current count for this Think's CPU Time. 
This value increases as more executions are done, may not be exactly as you want. 
If used on screens, will show 0 if only rendering is done. Operations must be done in the Think loop for them to be counted.

isValid.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.isValid
isValid.summary: Returns if the table has an isValid function and isValid returns true.
isValid.description: Returns if the table has an isValid function and isValid returns true.

param.tbl: Table to get the next key-value pair of

player.ret: Either the owner (server) or the local player (client)
player.description: Same as owner() on the server. On the client, returns the local player
player.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.player
player.summary: Same as owner() on the server.

quotaTotalAverage.ret: Total average CPU Time of all your chips.
quotaTotalAverage.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaTotalAverage
quotaTotalAverage.summary: Returns the total average time for all chips by the player.
quotaTotalAverage.description: Returns the total average time for all chips by the player.

param.level: Which level in the stacktrace to blame. Defaults to 1

quotaMax.ret: Max SysTime allowed to take for execution of the chip in a Think.
quotaMax.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaMax
quotaMax.description:
Gets the CPU Time max. 
CPU Time is stored in a buffer of N elements, if the average of this exceeds quotaMax, the chip will error.

getLibraries.description: Gets a list of all libraries

doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaUsed
doc.summary: Returns the current count for this Think's CPU Time.
doc.description:
Returns the current count for this Think's CPU Time. 
This value increases as more executions are done, may not be exactly as you want. 
If used on screens, will show 0 if only rendering is done. Operations must be done in the Think loop for them to be counted.

doc.ret: Average CPU Time of the buffer.
doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaAverage
doc.summary: Gets the Average CPU Time in the buffer
doc.description: Gets the Average CPU Time in the buffer

doc.ret: Total used CPU time of all your chips.

doc.summary: Returns the total used time for all chips by the player.
doc.description: Returns the total used time for all chips by the player.

doc.ret: Total average CPU Time of all your chips.
doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaTotalAverage
doc.summary: Returns the total average time for all chips by the player.
doc.description: Returns the total average time for all chips by the player.

doc.ret: Max SysTime allowed to take for execution of the chip in a Think.
doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.quotaMax
doc.summary: Gets the CPU Time max.
doc.description:
Gets the CPU Time max. 
CPU Time is stored in a buffer of N elements, if the average of this exceeds quotaMax, the chip will error.

doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.setSoftQuota
doc.summary: Sets a CPU soft quota which will trigger a catchable error if the cpu goes over a certain amount.
doc.description: Sets a CPU soft quota which will trigger a catchable error if the cpu goes over a certain amount.

param.quota: The threshold where the soft error will be thrown. Ratio of current cpu to the max cpu usage. 0.5 is 50%

doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.debugGetInfo
doc.summary:
GLua's getinfo() 
Returns a DebugInfo structure containing the passed function's info (https://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Structures/DebugInfo)
doc.description:
GLua's getinfo() 
Returns a DebugInfo structure containing the passed function's info (https://wiki.garrysmod.com/page/Structures/DebugInfo)

param.funcOrStackLevel: Function or stack level to get info about. Defaults to stack level 0.
param.fields: A string that specifies the information to be retrieved. Defaults to all (flnSu).

ret: If the function had no errors occur within it.
If an error occurred, this will be a string containing the error message. Otherwise, this will be the return values of the function passed in.
doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.pcall
doc.summary:
Lua's pcall with SF throw implementation 
Calls a function and catches an error that can be thrown while the execution of the call.
doc.description:
Lua's pcall with SF throw implementation 
Calls a function and catches an error that can be thrown while the execution of the call.

param.func: Function to be executed and of which the errors should be caught of
param.arguments: Arguments to call the function with.

ret: Status of the execution; true for success, false for failure.
The returns of the first function if execution succeeded, otherwise the first return value of the error callback.
doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.xpcall
doc.summary:
Lua's xpcall with SF throw implementation 
Attempts to call the first function.
doc.description:
Lua's xpcall with SF throw implementation 
Attempts to call the first function. If the execution succeeds, this returns true followed by the returns of the function. 
If execution fails, this returns false and the second function is called with the error message.

param.The: function to be called if execution of the first fails; the error message is passed as a string.
param.arguments: Arguments to pass to the initial function.

doc.name: SF.DefaultEnvironment.try
doc.summary:
Try to execute a function and catch possible exceptions 
Similar to xpcall, but a bit more in-depth
doc.description:
Try to execute a function and catch possible exceptions 
Similar to xpcall, but a bit more in-depth

param.catch: Optional function to execute in case func fails

SF.Sanitize.name: SF.Sanitize
SF.Sanitize.summary: Sanitizes and returns its argument list.
SF.Sanitize.description:
Sanitizes and returns its argument list. 
Basic types are returned unchanged. Non-object tables will be 
recursed into and their keys and values will be sanitized. Object 
types will be wrapped if a wrapper is available. When a wrapper is 
not available objects will be replaced with nil, so as to prevent 
any possiblitiy of leakage. Functions will always be replaced with 
nil as there is no way to verify that they are safe.

ret: The function to wrap sensitive values to a SF-safe table
The function to unwrap the SF-safe table to the sensitive table
SF.CreateWrapper.name: SF.CreateWrapper
SF.CreateWrapper.summary:
Creates wrap/unwrap functions for sensitive values, by using a lookup table 
(which is set to have weak keys and values)
SF.CreateWrapper.description:
Creates wrap/unwrap functions for sensitive values, by using a lookup table 
(which is set to have weak keys and values)

param.target_metatable:
(optional) The metatable of the object that will get 
wrapped by these wrapper functions.  This is required if you want to 
have the object be auto-recognized by the generic SF.WrapObject 
function.
param.metatable: The metatable to assign the wrapped value.
param.weaksensitive: Make the sensitive data weak inside the internal lookup table. Default: True
param.weakwrapper: Make the wrapper weak inside the internal lookup table. Default: True

drawRoundedBoxEx.description: Draws a rounded rectangle using the current color

createFont.name: render_library.createFont
createFont.usage:
Base font can be one of (keep in mind that these may not exist on all clients if they are not shipped with starfall): 
- Akbar 
- Coolvetica 
- Roboto 
- Courier New 
- Verdana 
- Arial 
- HalfLife2 
- hl2mp 
- csd 
- Tahoma 
- Trebuchet 
- Trebuchet MS 
- DejaVu Sans Mono 
- Lucida Console 
- Times New Roman
createFont.description: Creates a font. Does not require rendering hook

param.additive: If true, adds brightness to pixels behind it rather than drawing over them.

createRenderTarget.name: render_library.createRenderTarget
createRenderTarget.summary: Creates a new render target to draw onto.
createRenderTarget.description:
Creates a new render target to draw onto. 
The dimensions will always be 1024x1024

param.name: The name of the render target

disableScissorRect.name: render_library.disableScissorRect
disableScissorRect.summary: Disables a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.
disableScissorRect.description: Disables a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.

isHUDActive.name: render_library.isHUDActive
isHUDActive.summary: Checks if a hud component is connected to the Starfall Chip
isHUDActive.description: Checks if a hud component is connected to the Starfall Chip

traceSurfaceColor.ret: The color vector. use vector:toColor to convert it to a color.
traceSurfaceColor.name: render_library.traceSurfaceColor
traceSurfaceColor.summary: Does a trace and returns the color of the textel the trace hits.
traceSurfaceColor.description: Does a trace and returns the color of the textel the trace hits.

ret: the X size of the current render context
the Y size of the current render context
getResolution.name: render_library.getResolution
getResolution.summary: Returns the render context's width and height
getResolution.description: Returns the render context's width and height

param.y: Y coordinate of center of rect
param.x: X coordinate of center of rect

parseMarkup.name: render_library.parseMarkup
parseMarkup.summary: Constructs a markup object for quick styled text drawing.
parseMarkup.description: Constructs a markup object for quick styled text drawing.

param.maxsize: The max width of the markup

readPixel.ret: Color object with ( r, g, b, 255 ) from the specified pixel.
readPixel.name: render_library.readPixel
readPixel.summary: Reads the color of the specified pixel.
readPixel.description: Reads the color of the specified pixel.

getTextSize.name: render_library.getTextSize
getTextSize.summary: Gets the size of the specified text.
getTextSize.description: Gets the size of the specified text. Don't forget to use setFont before calling this function

param.text: Text to get the size of

drawRectOutline.name: render_library.drawRectOutline
drawRectOutline.summary: Draws a rectangle outline using the current color.
drawRectOutline.description: Draws a rectangle outline using the current color.

setRGBA.name: render_library.setRGBA
setRGBA.summary: Sets the draw color by RGBA values
setRGBA.description: Sets the draw color by RGBA values

drawText.name: render_library.drawText
drawText.summary: Draws text with newlines and tabs
drawText.description: Draws text with newlines and tabs

drawSimpleText.name: render_library.drawSimpleText
drawSimpleText.summary: Draws text more easily and quickly but no new lines or tabs.
drawSimpleText.description: Draws text more easily and quickly but no new lines or tabs.

cursorPos.summary: Gets a 2D cursor position where ply is aiming.
cursorPos.description: Gets a 2D cursor position where ply is aiming.

param.ply: player to get cursor position from

drawRoundedBox.name: render_library.drawRoundedBox
drawRoundedBox.summary: Draws a rounded rectangle using the current color
drawRoundedBox.description: Draws a rounded rectangle using the current color

draw3DWireframeBox.name: render_library.draw3DWireframeBox
draw3DWireframeBox.summary: Draws a wireframe box in 3D space
draw3DWireframeBox.description: Draws a wireframe box in 3D space

param.maxs: End position of the box, relative to origin.
param.mins: Start position of the box, relative to origin.

drawRect.name: render_library.drawRect
drawRect.summary: Draws a rectangle using the current color.
drawRect.description: Draws a rectangle using the current color.

param.textureStart: The start coordinate of the texture used.
param.textureEnd: The end coordinate of the texture used.

param.maxs: End position of the box, relative to origin.
param.mins: Start position of the box, relative to origin.

selectRenderTarget.name: render_library.selectRenderTarget
selectRenderTarget.summary: Selects the render target to draw on.
selectRenderTarget.description:
Selects the render target to draw on. 
Nil for the visible RT.

param.name: Name of the render target to use

enableScissorRect.name: render_library.enableScissorRect
enableScissorRect.summary: Enables a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.
enableScissorRect.description: Enables a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area. Only works 2D contexts such as HUD or render targets.

param.startY: Y start coordinate of the scissor rect.
param.endX: Y end coordinate of the scissor rect.
param.startX: X start coordinate of the scissor rect.

param.longitudeSteps: The amount of longitude steps. The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is
param.latitudeSteps: The amount of latitude steps. The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is

getRenderTargetMaterial.ret: Model material name. Send this to the server to set the entity's material.
getRenderTargetMaterial.name: render_library.getRenderTargetMaterial
getRenderTargetMaterial.summary: Returns the model material name that uses the render target.
getRenderTargetMaterial.description: Returns the model material name that uses the render target.

param.longitudeSteps: The amount of longitude steps. The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is
param.latitudeSteps: The amount of latitude steps. The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is

getTextureID.ret: Texture table. Use it with render.setTexture. Returns nil if max url textures is reached.
getTextureID.name: render_library.getTextureID
getTextureID.summary: Looks up a texture by file name.
getTextureID.description:
Looks up a texture by file name. Use with render.setTexture to draw with it. 
Make sure to store the texture to use it rather than calling this slow function repeatedly.

param.tx: Texture file path, or a http url
param.alignment: Optional alignment for the url texture. Default: "center", See http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/pr_background-position.asp
param.cb: Optional callback for when a url texture finishes loading. param1 - The texture table, param2 - The texture url

getScreenEntity.ret: Entity of the screen or hud being rendered
getScreenEntity.name: render_library.getScreenEntity
getScreenEntity.summary: Returns the entity currently being rendered to
getScreenEntity.description: Returns the entity currently being rendered to

setFont.name: render_library.setFont
setFont.usage:
Use a font created by render.createFont or use one of these already defined fonts: 
- DebugFixed 
- DebugFixedSmall 
- Default 
- Marlett 
- Trebuchet18 
- Trebuchet24 
- HudHintTextLarge 
- HudHintTextSmall 
- CenterPrintText 
- HudSelectionText 
- CloseCaption_Normal 
- CloseCaption_Bold 
- CloseCaption_BoldItalic 
- ChatFont 
- TargetID 
- TargetIDSmall 
- HL2MPTypeDeath 
- BudgetLabel 
- HudNumbers 
- DermaDefault 
- DermaDefaultBold 
- DermaLarge

param.poly: Table of polygon vertices. Texture coordinates are optional. {{x=x1, y=y1, u=u1, v=v1}, ... }

getScreenInfo.name: render_library.getScreenInfo
getScreenInfo.summary: Returns information about the screen, such as world offsets, dimentions, and rotation.
getScreenInfo.description:
Returns information about the screen, such as world offsets, dimentions, and rotation.

doc.summary: Creates a font.
doc.name: render_library.createFont
doc.usage:
Base font can be one of (keep in mind that these may not exist on all clients if they are not shipped with starfall): 
- Akbar 
- Coolvetica 
- Roboto 
- Courier New 
- Verdana 
- Arial 
- HalfLife2 
- hl2mp 
- csd 
- Tahoma 
- Trebuchet 
- Trebuchet MS 
- DejaVu Sans Mono 
- Lucida Console 
- Times New Roman
doc.description: Creates a font. Does not require rendering hook

param.additive: If true, adds brightness to pixels behind it rather than drawing over them.

doc.name: render_library.getTextSize
doc.summary: Gets the size of the specified text.
doc.description: Gets the size of the specified text. Don't forget to use setFont before calling this function

param.text: Text to get the size of

doc.summary: Sets the font
doc.name: render_library.setFont
doc.usage:
Use a font created by render.createFont or use one of these already defined fonts: 
- DebugFixed 
- DebugFixedSmall 
- Default 
- Marlett 
- Trebuchet18 
- Trebuchet24 
- HudHintTextLarge 
- HudHintTextSmall 
- CenterPrintText 
- HudSelectionText 
- CloseCaption_Normal 
- CloseCaption_Bold 
- CloseCaption_BoldItalic 
- ChatFont 
- TargetID 
- TargetIDSmall 
- HL2MPTypeDeath 
- BudgetLabel 
- HudNumbers 
- DermaDefault 
- DermaDefaultBold 
- DermaLarge
doc.description: Sets the font

not be called more than once.

make sense (ex timers).

examples.fireplace.lua:
--@name Fireplace
--@author INP - Radon
--@include lib/class.txt

if SERVER then return end

-- Credits to Natty for original fireplace idea as an example
-- Credits to funkake for working out the kinks

-- We'll require our Class library, courtesy of Xandaros
-- Latest version of Class Lib: https://gist.github.com/Xandaros/ea8756e4c4ba00218855

-- It makes a global called Class()
require( "lib/class.txt" )

-- We'll call Particle as our constructor
local Particle = Class()

-- Let's add our constructor definition
function Particle:constructor ( x, y, scale, xv, yv, clr )
	-- Just standard assignment, we want to make sure we get all the properties.
	-- If one of the params is nil, then the default value, 0, will be assigned.
	self.x = x or 0
	self.y = y or 0
	self.scale = scale or 0
	self.x_vel = xv or 0
	self.y_vel = yv or 0
	self.color = clr or Color( 0, 0, 0 )
end

-- A think method, we'll use this to change particle states.
function Particle:think ()
	-- We draw first, then change state.

	self:draw()

	self.x = self.x + self.x_vel
	self.y = self.y + self.y_vel

	self.y_vel = self.y_vel - math.random( 0, 0.04 )

	self.color.a = self.color.a - math.random( 1.5, 3 )

	local c = self.color.g - math.random( 0.65, 0.95 )
	self.color.g = c > 0 and c or 0

	local c = self.color.r + math.random( 0.4, 0.6 )
	self.color.r = c < 255 and c or 255

	self.scale = self.scale - math.random( 0.20, 0.30 )
end

-- draw method so that each pixel can be drawn by itself.
function Particle:draw ()
	render.setColor( self.color )
	render.drawRect( self.x + 256, self.y + 480, self.scale, self.scale )
end

-- Little table to store some information about the display.
local game = {}
game.particles = {}

-- Timers, we'll use these to spawn new particles and to draw our current ones.
-- This helps us keep constant time when rendering.
local t = timer.systime()
local t2 = timer.systime()

hook.add( "render", "", function ()

	if timer.systime() > t then
		for i = 1, math.random( 4, 10 ) do

			-- Make a new particle using our constructor.
			local nP = Particle(
				math.random( -256, 256 ),
				math.random( -64, 32 ),
				math.random( 40, 80 ),
				math.random() * 5 - 2,
				-math.random() * 3,
				Color( math.random( 200, 230 ), math.random( 100, 130 ), 0, math.random( 120, 255 ) )
				)

			-- Add our newly made particle to a table of game particles
			table.insert( game.particles, nP )

		end

		-- Increase our timer for our next spawn time.
		t = timer.systime() + ( 1 / 20 )
	end

	if timer.systime() > t2 then

		game.relVel = entities.self():worldToLocal( entities.self():getPos() + entities.self():getVelocity() )

		-- Clear the board before rendering anything new
		render.clear( Color( 5, 5, 16 ) )

		for k, v in pairs( game.particles ) do
			-- Now iterate over all our particles and check if they should be removed.
			if v.color.a <= 0 then table.remove( game.particles, k ) continue end

			-- This is responsible for moving our flames if we shake our screen.
			-- Moves sprites based upon their scale.
			v.x_vel = v.x_vel - ( game.relVel.y * ( 1/ 5000 ) * ( 80 / v.scale ) )
			v.y_vel = v.y_vel - ( game.relVel.x * ( 1/ 2000 ) * ( 80 / v.scale ) )

			-- We only need to think.
			-- Our function draws before thinking, so we're fine.
			v:think()
		end

		-- Increase our timer for our next draw time.
		t2 = timer.systime() + ( 1 / 120 )
	end
end )
examples.coroutine.lua:
--@name Coroutine Example
--@author Radon

if not SERVER then return end

-- Some functions for checking our quota usage.
local function checkQ ( n )
	return quotaUsed() < quotaMax() * n
end

-- Check if we should yield
local function yieldCheck ()
	if not checkQ( 0.95 ) then
		coroutine.yield()
	end
end

-- Create the coroutine
-- The Function here is "Sieve of Eratosthenes" and is used to find Primes up to a given integer.
local erato = coroutine.create( function ( n )

		local time = timer.systime()
		if n < 2 then return {} end
		local t = { 0 } -- clears '1'
		local sqrtlmt = math.sqrt( n )

		for i = 2, n do
			-- Because we're in a for loop, best make sure we check to yield.
			yieldCheck()
			t[ i ] = 1
		end

		for i = 2, sqrtlmt do
			if t[ i ] != 0 then
				-- Because we're in a for loop, best make sure we check to yield.
				yieldCheck()
				for j = i * i, n, i do
					-- Because we're in a for loop, best make sure we check to yield.
					yieldCheck()
					t[ j ] = 0
				end
			end
		end

		local primes = {}
		for i = 2, n do
			-- Because we're in a for loop, best make sure we check to yield.
			yieldCheck()
			if t[ i ] != 0 then
				table.insert( primes, i )
			end
		end

		-- Finally we want to return our table of primes we've generated.
		-- Therefore we yield but pass it the table to yield back.
		print( ( timer.systime() - time ) .. " seconds to complete" )
		coroutine.yield( primes )
end )

hook.add( "think", "primeNumbers", function ()
	-- If the coroutine isn't running and hasn't died, then we need to start it or resume it.
	if coroutine.status( erato ) != "running" and coroutine.status( erato ) ~= "dead" then
		-- Make sure we're sufficiently below quota to resume
		if checkQ( 0.1 ) then
			-- r will be nil until the final yield which gives us our primes.
			-- This will start / resume the coroutine.
			local r = coroutine.resume( erato, 5000000 )

			-- Therefore we check if it's not nil, and print the highest prime.
			if r then
				print( "Highest prime: " .. r[ #r ] )
			end
		end
	end

	-- Since we've finished calculating all our primes, remove our think hook.
	if coroutine.status( erato ) == "dead" then
		hook.remove( "think", "primeNumbers" )
	end
end )

examples.console.lua:
--@name Console
--@author Sparky

if SERVER then
	
	wire.adjustInputs({"Keyboard","Console"},{"Wirelink","Wirelink"})
	
	hook.add("input","getwirelinks",function(name, val)
		if name == "Console" then
			Console = val
		elseif name == "Keyboard" then
			Keyboard = val
		end
	end)
	
	local ConsolePos = 0
	local ConsoleInit = false
	
	local function updateCursor()
		Console[2045] = ConsolePos
		Console[2046] = 1
	end
	local function cls()
		Console[2041] = 1
		ConsolePos = 0
		updateCursor()
	end
	local function cout(str, color)
		for I=1, #str do
			if str[I] == "\n" then
				while ConsolePos % 60 != 0 do
					Console[ConsolePos] = 0
					ConsolePos = ConsolePos + 2
				end
			else
				Console[ConsolePos] = str:byte(I)
				Console[ConsolePos+1] = color or 999
				ConsolePos = ConsolePos + 2
			end
		end
		updateCursor()
	end
	local cincb, cinstart
	local function cin(cb)
		cinstart = ConsolePos
		cincb = cb
	end
	local function getcin()
		local chars = {}
		for I=cinstart, ConsolePos-2, 2 do
			chars[#chars + 1] = string.char(Console[I])
		end
		return table.concat(chars)
	end
	
	key_funcs = {
		[127] = function()
			Console[ConsolePos] = 0
			updateCursor()
			ConsolePos = math.max(ConsolePos - 2, cinstart)
		end,
		[9] = function() end,
		[13] = function() 
			if cincb then
				local str = getcin()
				cout("\n")
				cincb(str)
				cincb = nil
			end
		end,
		[154] = function() end,
		[155] = function() end,
		[158] = function() end,
		[159] = function() end,
	}
	key_funcs[142] = key_funcs[13]
	
	local function main_loop()
		if not Keyboard or not Console then
			Initialized = false
		else
			if not Initialized then
				Initialized = true
				cls()
				main()
			end
			while Keyboard[0] > 0 do
				if cincb then
					if key_funcs[Keyboard[1]] then key_funcs[Keyboard[1]]()
					else
						--print(Keyboard[1])
						Console[ConsolePos] = Keyboard[1]
						Console[ConsolePos+1] = 999
						
						ConsolePos = ConsolePos + 2
						updateCursor()
					end
				end
			
				Keyboard[0] = 0
			end
		end
	end
	hook.add("Think","Mainloop",main_loop)

	function main()
		cout("Type hello: ")
		cin(function(str)
			if str == "hello" then
				cout("Hi!\n")
			else
				cout("WRONG!!!\n",800999)
			end
			timer.simple(0,main)
		end)
	end
end
examples.screencpuTime.lua:
--@name cpuTime Example
--@author INP - Radon + Sparky
--@client

-- This function helps us check if we can run.
-- Use a mixture of quotaUsed() and quotaAverage()
-- quotaUsed() returns the value of the current buffer.
-- quotaAverage() gives the cpuTime average across the whole buffer.
-- You chip will quota if quotaAverage() > quotaMax()
-- n is a parameter between 0 and 1 that represents the percent. 0.8 = 80%.
local function quotaCheck ( n )
	return ( quotaUsed() < quotaMax() * n ) and ( quotaAverage() < quotaMax() )
end

-- Round function to certain dp.
local function round ( num, idp )
  local mult = 10 ^ ( idp or 0 )
  return math.floor( num * mult + 0.5 ) / mult
end

local rt = render.createRenderTarget( "Background" )
-- Standard render hook, see hooks.
hook.add( "render", "", function ()
	render.setColor( Color( 255, 255, 255 ) )    
	-- Print some stats to the screen
	render.drawText( 10, 10, "Quota Used: " .. round( quotaUsed()*1000000 ) .. "us" )
	render.drawText( 10, 30, "Quota Avg: " .. round( quotaAverage()*1000000 ) .. "us" )
	render.drawText( 10, 50, "Quota Max: " .. round( quotaMax()*1000000 ) .. "us" )
	render.drawText( 10, 70, "Percent: " .. round( quotaAverage() / quotaMax() * 100, 2 ) .. "%" )
	
	-- Set the rendertarget to our background so that we can make a bluring effect
	render.selectRenderTarget( "Background" )
	render.setColor( Color( 0, 0, 0, 50 ) )
	render.drawRect( 0, 0, 1024, 1024 )
	
	-- While our quota is less than 2 percent.
	-- This will result in higher FPS, thus more render calls.
	-- You'd think this would affect the rendering of the cube, it doesn't.
	-- If you increase this check to 99%, FPS will significantly drop, and the movement would be slower.
	-- Play with this value and see the effects on percentage and your FPS.
	while( quotaCheck( 0.01 ) ) do
		-- Now we can draw a funky box that oscillates back and forth in the middle of the screen.
		render.setColor( Color( math.random( 100, 255 ), math.random( 100, 255 ), math.random( 100, 255 ) ) )
		render.drawRect( math.sin( timer.curtime()*2 ) * 380 + ( 512 - 100 ), 512 / 2, 200, 400 )
	end
	render.selectRenderTarget( nil )
	
	-- Draw the resulting rendertarget
	render.setRenderTargetTexture( "Background" )
	render.setColor( Color( 255, 255, 255 ) )
	render.drawTexturedRect( 0, 128, 512, 384 )
end)
examples.class.lua:
--@name Class
--@author Xandaros

--Class library, most recent version can be found here: https://gist.github.com/Xandaros/ea8756e4c4ba00218855

local function callConstructor(class, obj, ...)
	local meta = getmetatable(class)
	if meta.__super then
		if class.superArgs then
			callConstructor(meta.__super, obj, class.superArgs(...))
		else
			callConstructor(meta.__super, obj)
		end
	end
	if class.constructor then
		class.constructor(obj, ...)
	end
end

local function instantiate(class, ...)
	local ret = setmetatable({}, {
		__index = class
	})
	callConstructor(class, ret, ...)
	return ret
end

function Class(name, superclass)
	local ret = {}
	setmetatable(ret, {
		__index = function(self, key)
			if key != "constructor" and superclass then
				return superclass[key]
			end
			return nil
		end,
		__super = superclass,
		__call = instantiate,
		__tostring = function() return name or "unknown" end
	})
	return ret
end
examples.sync.lua:
--@name Sync
--@author INP

if SERVER then
	-- Code only executed on the server
	local randomNumber = math.floor( math.random() * 100 )

	hook.add( "net", "uniqueHookNameHere", function ( name, len, ply )
		-- ply being the client that sent the net message
		-- A client is asking for the number
		if name == "request" then
			-- Send it to the client
			net.start( "number" )
				-- 8 is the amount of bits to use for the transmission
				net.writeInt( randomNumber, 8 )
			net.send( ply )
		end
	end )
else
	-- Code only executed on the client
	local randomNumber

	local font = render.createFont( "Default", 62 )

	-- Send a request for the number to the server
	net.start( "request" )
	net.send()

	hook.add( "net", "uniqueHookNameHerev2", function ( name, len )
		-- No client argument, since it can only come from the server
		-- The server is sending us the number
		if name == "number" then
			randomNumber = net.readInt( 8 )
		end
	end )

	-- The render hook is called every frame the client requires the screen to be rendered
	-- If the client has 120 FPS then this hook will be called 120 in a second.
	hook.add( "render", "renderHook", function ()
		render.clear()
		if randomNumber then
			render.setColor( Color( 0,255,255,255 ) )
			render.setFont( font )
			render.drawText( 20, 20, tostring( randomNumber ) )
		end
	end )
end

examples.Filetransfer.lua:
--@name Filetransfer
--@author Sparky
--@shared

--File transfer library. Allows sending strings much larger than the limit size.
--Example usage
---------------------
----SERVER
---------------------
--local filetransfer = require("filetransfer.txt")
--
--net.start("myfile")
--filetransfer.write("mydata")
--net.send()

---------------------
----CLIENT
---------------------
--hook.add("net","",function(name,len)
--	if name=="myfile" then
--		filetransfer.read(function(data)
--			if data then
--				print(data)
--			end
--		end)
--	end
--end)

local filetransfer = {}
filetransfer.uploadcache = {}
filetransfer.downloadqueue = {}

local packetsize = 1000

local function duelSend(ply)
	if SERVER then
		net.send(ply)
	else
		net.send()
	end
end

local function processQueue()
	local item = filetransfer.downloadqueue[1]
	if not item then return end
	
	net.start("ftreqdata")
	net.writeUInt(item.index, 16)
	net.writeUInt(#item.pieces, 16)
	duelSend(item.ply)
	
	if timer.exists("ftdownloadtimeout"..item.index) then
		timer.adjust("ftdownloadtimeout"..item.index, 10, 1)
	else
		timer.create("ftdownloadtimeout"..item.index, 10, 1, function()
			item.callback(nil)
			table.remove(filetransfer.downloadqueue, 1)
			timer.remove("ftkeepalive"..item.index)
			processQueue()
		end)
	end
end

local function sendData(index, ply)
	local part = net.readUInt(16)
	local function timetosend()
		local data = filetransfer.uploadcache[index]
		if not data then return end
		local senddata = string.sub(data, part*packetsize+1, math.min(part*packetsize+packetsize, #data))
			
		if net.getBytesLeft()<#senddata+100 then
			timer.simple(0.1, timetosend)
			return
		end
		
		net.start("ftrecvdata")
		net.writeUInt(index, 16)
		net.writeData(senddata, #senddata)
		duelSend(ply)
	end
	timetosend()
end

local function gotData(index, ply)
	local item = filetransfer.downloadqueue[1]
	if not item then return end
	
	item.pieces[#item.pieces+1] = net.readData(packetsize)
	
	if #item.pieces == item.numpieces then
		local data = fastlz.decompress(table.concat(item.pieces))
		item.callback(data)
		table.remove(filetransfer.downloadqueue, 1)
		timer.remove("ftdownloadtimeout"..item.index)
		timer.remove("ftkeepalive"..item.index)
	end
	processQueue()
end

function filetransfer.write(data)
	local compressed = fastlz.compress(data)
	local index = 1
	while filetransfer.uploadcache[index] do
		index = index + 1
	end
	filetransfer.uploadcache[index] = compressed
	
	timer.create("ftcachetimeout"..index,10,1,function() filetransfer.uploadcache[index] = nil end)
	
	net.writeUInt(index, 16)
	net.writeUInt(math.ceil(#compressed/packetsize),16)
end

function filetransfer.read(callback, ply)
	local index = net.readUInt(16)
	local numpieces = net.readUInt(16)
	local item = {
		index = index,
		numpieces = numpieces,
		pieces = {},
		ply = ply,
		callback = callback
	}
	
	local queuelen = #filetransfer.downloadqueue
	filetransfer.downloadqueue[queuelen+1] = item
	if queuelen == 0 then
		processQueue()
	end
	timer.create("ftkeepalive"..index, 3, 0, function()
		net.start("ftkeepalive")
		net.writeUInt(index,16)
		duelSend(ply)
	end)
end

hook.add("net","filetransfer",function(name,len,ply)
	
	local index = net.readUInt(16)
	if CLIENT then ply = nil end
	
	if name == "ftrecvdata" then
		gotData(index, ply)
	elseif name == "ftkeepalive" then
		timer.adjust("ftcachetimeout"..index,10,1)
	elseif name == "ftreqdata" then
		timer.adjust("ftcachetimeout"..index,10,1)
		sendData(index, ply)
	end
	
end)

return filetransfer

-- This file gets included in the include example

	print( "Hello World!" )

return 5 -- Return a value
examples.cpuTime.lua:
--@name cpuTime Example
--@author INP - Radon

if CLIENT then return end

-- This function helps us check if we can run.
-- Use a mixture of quotaUsed() and quotaAverage()
-- quotaUsed() returns the value of the current buffer.
-- quotaAverage() gives the cpuTime average across the whole buffer.
-- You chip will quota if quotaAverage() > quotaMax()
-- n is a parameter between 0 and 1 that represents the percent. 0.8 = 80%.
local function quotaCheck ( n )
	return ( quotaUsed() < quotaMax() * n ) and ( quotaAverage() < quotaMax() )
end

-- Standard think hook, see hook example for this.
hook.add( "think", "", function ()
	-- Simple incrementer inside a while loop
	local i = 0
	while( quotaCheck( 0.95 ) ) do
		-- We'll increment until we reach 95%
		i = i + 1
	end
	-- Then print the final counter, this is how many times the while loop executed this think
	print( i )
end )

include.description:
Mark a file to be included in the upload. 
This is required to use the file in require() and dofile()
include.name: include
include.summary: Mark a file to be included in the upload.

param.path: Path to the file

includedir.description:
Mark a directory to be included in the upload. 
This is optional to include all files in the directory in require() and dofile()
includedir.name: includedir
includedir.summary: Mark a directory to be included in the upload.

param.path: Path to the directory

model.description:
Set the model of the processor entity. 
This does not set the model of the screen entity
model.name: model
model.summary: Set the model of the processor entity.

client.description: Set the processor to only run on the client. Shared is default
client.name: client
client.summary: Set the processor to only run on the client.

name.description:
Set the name of the script. 
This will become the name of the tab and will show on the overlay of the processor
name.name: name
name.summary: Set the name of the script.

server.description: Set the processor to only run on the server. Shared is default
server.name: server
server.summary: Set the processor to only run on the server.
